arm_group.arm_group_label: NVAF patients in Mexico treated with Apixaban
arm_group.description: All patients with NVAF at the sentinel site for the CNFV in Mexico who received at least 1 dose of Apixaban to reduce the risk of stroke or systemic embolism during the specified 24-month study period

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to identify and describe any suspected (AEs) in all
      patients with NVAF treated with Apixaban, as a request of the National Center of
      Pharmacovigilance (CNFV) in Mexico.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit
        www.BMSStudyConnect.com

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients with NVAF at the sentinel site for the CNFV in Mexico who received at
             least 1 dose of Apixaban to reduce the risk of stroke or systemic embolism during the
             specified 24-month study period

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who received Apixaban as part of a clinical trial

          -  Subjects who received Apixaban for any indication other than local approval (ie, to
             reduce the risk of stroke and systemic embolism in patients with NVAF)

study_pop.textblock: The sentinel site for the CNFV in Mexico

intervention.arm_group_label: NVAF patients in Mexico treated with Apixaban

primary_outcome.measure: Determine the reporting rate of on-treatment adverse events (AEs) by the treating physicians
Identify, describe, and report any suspected AEs that occur while on treatment with Apixaban or preventing stroke and systemic embolism in patients with NVAF

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
